skill.name: plot-consistency-checker
skill.description: Analyzes narrative plot points, timelines, and story events to identify inconsistencies, plot holes, continuity errors, and pacing issues. Use when the user needs help ensuring their story remains logically consistent and well-paced.
skill.summary: Analyzes narrative plot points, timelines, and story events to identify inconsistencies, plot holes,...
skill.author: AbdulSamad94

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. The SKILL.md file contains only instructional text for AI behavior. No file access, network calls, command execution, or external dependencies. Zero security risk factors detected.

content.user_title: Check Your Story for Plot Holes
content.value_statement: Writers often miss plot holes and timeline errors in their own work. This skill systematically tracks plot points, character actions, and world rules to identify inconsistencies before readers notice them.
actual_capabilities: Tracks plot threads from introduction to resolution
Identifies character motivation and description inconsistencies
Evaluates pacing and time allocation across chapters
limitations: Cannot access or read local files directly
Analyzes only text provided in conversation
Does not replace professional manuscript editing
Cannot verify historical or scientific accuracy of facts

use_cases.title: Manuscript revision before submission
use_cases.description: Authors can submit chapters for comprehensive consistency review before querying agents or self-publishing.

use_cases.title: Episode arc alignment
use_cases.description: TV writers can check that character actions and timelines remain consistent across multiple episodes.

use_cases.title: Series continuity maintenance
use_cases.description: Writers managing multi-book series can ensure each new book aligns with established rules and events.

prompt_templates.title: Basic check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check my story for plot inconsistencies. I have 5 chapters about a protagonist traveling to a magical city. Help me find any timeline errors, character contradictions, or plot holes.

prompt_templates.title: Character focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my manuscript focusing on character consistency. Main character Sarah starts shy but becomes confident. Check if her actions and dialogue align with this development across all chapters.

prompt_templates.title: World-building
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my fantasy novel for world-building consistency. My magic system has clear rules established in chapter 2. Flag any scenes where characters use magic in ways that violate those rules.

prompt_templates.title: Full manuscript
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete plot consistency analysis on my entire novel. Create trackers for timeline, characters, plot threads, and world rules. Provide a detailed report with specific chapter references and suggested fixes.

output_examples.input: Check my first 3 chapters for consistency. My protagonist Kael has blue eyes and travels from Riverhold to the Capital.
output: Timeline Issue Found: Travel time inconsistency. Chapter 1 establishes the Capital is 5 days away, but Chapter 3 has Kael arriving the next morning.
Character Consistency: Kael's eye color is consistently described as blue across all three chapters.
POV Check: No violations detected in third-person limited narration.
World Rules: No magic system established yet, so no violations possible.
Recommendation: Add a time skip or explain rapid travel method in Chapter 2.

best_practices: Provide the complete story synopsis before submitting chapters for analysis.
List any intentional contradictions (unreliable narrator, time loops, etc.) to avoid false positives.
Review the consistency report before making edits and prioritize critical plot holes first.
anti_patterns: Submitting isolated chapters without context of the full story arc.
Assuming the AI remembers details from previous sessions (always restate key facts).
Ignoring minor inconsistencies that could compound into larger plot holes.

faq.question: Which genres does this skill support?
faq.answer: Works with all fiction genres including fantasy, sci-fi, romance, mystery, thriller, and literary fiction.

faq.question: How much text can I submit at once?
faq.answer: Submit up to 10,000 words for detailed analysis. Break longer manuscripts into sections.

faq.question: Can I use this with existing writing tools?
faq.answer: Yes, copy text from any writing software (Scrivener, Word, Google Docs) into the conversation.

faq.question: Is my writing data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, your content is processed only within your conversation. Nothing is stored externally.

faq.question: What if the skill misses an error?
faq.answer: This is a writing aid, not a replacement for professional editing. Always do your own review.

faq.question: How is this different from grammar checkers?
faq.answer: Grammar checkers fix language errors. This skill analyzes story logic, character consistency, and narrative structure.
